definition: to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]

sentences.english: However, to further one's study for a master degree is quite a different choice.
sentences.chinese: 然而，继续读研是一个很不同的选择。

sentences.english: It has always been a hot topic whether collegians should go on study at a graduate school or just find a job when they graduate.
sentences.chinese: 毕业以后是选择读研还是找工作一直都被人们热议。

sentences.english: It used to be that people went to graduate school as a surefire way to achieve the American Dream.
sentences.chinese: 过去，人们把读研看成是通往美国梦的成功之路。

sentences.english: However, there are also parts of people abandon grad school.
sentences.chinese: 然而，也有一部分人放弃读研。

sentences.english: Some people think that students should broaden their knowledge circle and attend graduate school.
sentences.chinese: 一些人认为学生应该继续读研来扩大他们的知识面。

sentences.english: In recent years, raise on-the-job public figure socially " read grind hot " .
sentences.chinese: 近年来，社会上掀起在职人士“读研热”。

sentences.english: Anyone getting a merit citation second class can enter grad school without taking the exam after completion of the service obligation.
sentences.chinese: 获得二等功的在他们完成义务服役后可以免试读研。

definition: to recommend sb for postgraduate studies/to admit for postgraduate studies without taking the entrance exam
to sit an entrance exam for a graduate program
(of an audio device) to repeat a recorded phrase (e.g. for language learning)
to return to the same school and repeat a course from which one has already graduated, as a result of failing to get good enough results to progress to one's desired higher-level school
the Great Learning, one of the Four Books 四書|四书[Si4 shu1] in Confucianism
to join the faculty of one's alma mater upon graduation/to remain at school during vacation
master's degree/person who has a master's degree/learned person
